Append area code

Source: R/DataPrep.R
appendAreaCode.Rd

Append area code

appendAreaCode(
  table,
  areaPolygons,
  latName,
  lonName,
  colName,
  StratumName = "StratumName",
  strict = T
)

Arguments

table

data.table to be annotated.

areaPolygons

SpatialPolygonsDataFrame

latName

name of WGS84 lat column in 'table'

lonName

name of WGS84 lon column in 'table

colName

name of column to be appended to 'table'

StratumName

name of column in 'areaPolygons' that identify the area name

strict

logical determining whether to run in strict mode. See details.

Value

'table' with the area appended in the column 'colName'

Details

Appends a column with an area code to a table, based on positions.

If polygons are overlapping, so that one point may be in several polygons, an arbitrary choice is made and a warning is issued.

By default this function is run in 'strict' mode, meaning that it will halt with an error if some positions are not in any of the provided polygons, or if some positions are missing (NA). Turning of strict-mode accepts both these cases and the area code will be NA for these positions.

See also

Other spatial coding functions: AddAreaPositionStoxLanding(), AddStratumStoxBiotic(), AddStratumStoxLanding(), DefineAreaPosition(), DefineCarNeighbours(), LoadFdaStratumPolygon(), SetAreaPositionsBiotic(), appendPosition(), areaCodeConversionTable(), mergePolygons(), plotAreaComparison(), plotArea(), writeSpDataFrameAsWKT()
